snippet: A Florida voter registration scandal involving Nathan Sproul, a highly paid Republican operative, is just the latest case in which questions have been raised about his methods.
abstract: Florida voter registration scandal involving Nathan Sproul, a highly paid Republican operative, has spread to other states; complaints include allegations of registrations with similar signatures or false addresses, registrations filed under the names of dead people, and changed party affiliations on some forms; Republican Party, which paid him about $3 million in 2012 for work in five states, has severed its ties with him.
lead_paragraph: A Florida voter registration scandal involving Nathan Sproul, a highly paid Republican operative, is just the latest case in which questions have been raised about his methods.

headline.seo: Nathan Sproul, Long Trailed by Voter Fraud Claims
headline.main: G.O.P. Operative Long Trailed by Allegations of Voter Fraud
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Operative Long Trailed By Allegations of Voter Fraud
